reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Management program for the conservation of the recently rediscovered Hula painted frog latoni nigriventer

description.narrative: Conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. Programs in this element should be integrated with the Agriculture Area under Economic Growth and Conflict Mitigation and Reconciliation Area under the Peace and Security Category, when applicable and appropriate.

This award strives to conserve biodiversity and manage natural resources in ways that maintain their long-term viability and preserve their potential to meet the needs of present and future generations. Activities include combating illegal and corrupt exploitation of natural resources and the control of invasive species. This includes This project will aim to fill the gap in knowledge on this prominent rediscovered living animal by gathering data on its natural history. Fundamental information is required for development of a conservation management plan in the Hula reserve, and for the establishment of a breeding program for this species. These actions are expected to push this unique species away from the brink of extinction and extend its distribution into the recently re-flooded areas of the Hula Valley. Specific objectives include: (1) defining the current distribution of the Hula painted frog; (2) Defining the population size of the Hula painted frog; (3) Defining population structure; (4) Defining preferred habitat..

participating-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Fish and Wildlife Service/Office of International Affairs

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The United States' commitment to Israel's security is a longstanding cornerstone of U.S. policy in the Middle East. The United States is committed to ensuring that Israel is able to defend itself against a wide range of conventional and unconventional threats. U.S. assistance helps ensure that Israel maintains its Qualitative Military Edge (QME) over potential regional threats, preventing a shift in the security balance of the region and safeguarding U.S. interests. U.S. assistance to Israel is aimed at ensuring that Israel is sufficiently secure to take the historic steps necessary to reach a peace agreement with the Palestinians and for comprehensive regional peace.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Resource Management, United States Fish and Wildlife Service, Interior
